content: the golden hour sundress evokes feelings of bright summer sunsets and floral blooms beautiful lace detailing along the skirt and sleeves elevate an otherwise simple double-crocheted dress this dress is uniquely constructed by working the bodice flat before shaping the skirt in the round a free version of this pattern can be viewed on my blog 2 this dress is constructed by first working the bodice and then the skirt bodice will be worked flat beginning at the bottom front and working up towards the neckline separating to shape each shoulder and joining together to work down the back you will then join both ends of the bodice to work in the round from this point the skirt will be worked in the round downwards neckline and sleeves will then be worked at the end and seams will be worked on either side of the bodice to finish modifications for length will be noted in the pattern this dress pattern is designed in 9 sizes xs s m l xl 2x 3x 4x 5x bust/chest circumference 30 75 34 25 37 75 41 44 5 48 51 5 55 58 25 length 36 36 36 37 37 37 38 38 38 armhole depth 10 10 10 11 11 11 12 12 12 this dress is designed to be worn with 0-4 of positive ease at the bust model is 6 tall has a 33 bust and is wearing a size small with 1 25 of positive ease for best fit choose a size that is 0-4 larger than your corresponding bust measurement alternatively if you prefer the dress to fit more snugly around your waist with negative ease at your bust choose a size that is closest to your waist measurement materials 7 7 8 9 10 10 11 12 13 skeins / 1302 1302 1488 1674 1860 1860 2046 2232 2418 yards lion brand 24/7 cotton yarn shown in camel size us g-6 4 00 mm crochet hook removable stitch marker tapestry needle to weave in ends gauge 14 sts and 8 row = 4 in double_crochet this
